page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: The D-block from which we obtained our information is located in the southern part of the Lake District and is therefore largely rural. The inhabitants are centred chiefly on the three villages of Backbarrow. Bouth and Haverthwaite, each of which is of long-standing. Backbarrow contains the site of an ironworks which was founded at the beginning of the 18th century. John Wilkinson, the iron master, often described as the "Founder of the Industrial Revolution" spent the early part of his career living in the village at Bare Syke. Another notable feature of the area is the presence of the Bigland family in their family seat at Bigland Hall. It is believed that the family is one of the few in the North of England to have been in residence since the Norman Conquest.
